org.threadly.concurrent.limiter

Class AbstractThreadPoolLimiter

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.threadly.concurrent.limiter.AbstractThreadPoolLimiter
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractSchedulerLimiter, ExecutorLimiter

    public abstract class AbstractThreadPoolLimiter
extends java.lang.Object
    Abstract implementation for classes which limit concurrency for a parent thread pool.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      protected class  AbstractThreadPoolLimiter.LimiterRunnableWrapper
      Generic wrapper for runnables which are used within the limiters.

    • Field Summary

      protected java.lang.String subPoolName

      Constructor for abstract class to call into for anyone extending this class.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      protected boolean canRunTask()
      Is block to verify a task can run in a thread safe way.
      protected abstract void consumeAvailable()
      Will run as many waiting tasks as it can.
      int getMaxConcurrency()
      Call to check what the maximum concurrency this limiter will allow.
      protected void handleTaskFinished()
      Should be called after every task completes.

    • Field Detail

      • maxConcurrency

        protected final int maxConcurrency

      • subPoolName

        protected final java.lang.String subPoolName

    • Constructor Detail

      • AbstractThreadPoolLimiter

        public AbstractThreadPoolLimiter(int maxConcurrency,
                         java.lang.String subPoolName)
        Constructor for abstract class to call into for anyone extending this class.
        Parameters:
        maxConcurrency - maximum concurrency to allow
        subPoolName - name to give threads while tasks running in pool (null to not change thread names)

    • Method Detail

      • getMaxConcurrency

        public int getMaxConcurrency()
        Call to check what the maximum concurrency this limiter will allow.
        Returns:
        maximum concurrent tasks to be run

      • makeSubPoolThreadName

        protected java.lang.String makeSubPoolThreadName(java.lang.String originalThreadName)
        Constructs a formated name for a given thread for this sub pool. This only makes sense to call when subPoolName is not null.
        Parameters:
        originalThreadName - name of thread before change
        Returns:
        a formated name to change the thread to.

      • canRunTask

        protected boolean canRunTask()
        Is block to verify a task can run in a thread safe way. If this returns true currentlyRunning has been incremented and it expects the task to run and call handleTaskFinished when completed.
        Returns:
        returns true if the task can run

      • consumeAvailable

        protected abstract void consumeAvailable()
        Will run as many waiting tasks as it can.

      • handleTaskFinished

        protected void handleTaskFinished()
        Should be called after every task completes. This decrements currentlyRunning in a thread safe way, then will run any waiting tasks which exists.
